Reviews.Title: Good for Pictures, Bad for Action (GoPro) Video (Too Shaky along shaft axis!)
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Lea
Reviews.Content: A little background first.  The Pocket Xshot is the 3rd retractable monopod I've tried to use with my GoPro HD camera.  The first one I used was some cheap "vidpro" and the second being the "quikpod compod".  They both had the same issue of the shaft being able to rotate freely around itself.  This caused a huge problem when trying to record video while snowboarding, as the weight of the GoPro would often cause the camera to rotate along the shaft (yes I know you can record upside down but I personally do not like to do that).Enter the Pocket Xshot.  I was quite excited to see that the Pocket Xshot has these "Channels" running through the entire length of the telescoping shaft.  This prevents the shaft from rotating on axis!  However, the unfortunate thing about this, is that there is a bit of play along the that "channel", as well as a bit of play in the plastic head that's mounted in the shaft.  Now this bit of play can get quite annoying with videos, as it looks like the camera is being shaken on axis many times a second.  This isn't as apparent in 60fps mode, because the image is more smooth, but it is VERY obvious in any 30fps filming modes.This would be fine for taking pictures, as you would only need one frame for a picture.  However, if you plan on using this to record any action video, the bit of play will be too shaky for some.Note 1:  The play in the shaft will increase over time, I've noticed these "channels" have gotten looser over the course of the last year (from vibrating back and forth) and now the play is even more excessiveNote 2:  I ordered another new xshot, to compare the amount of free play between a new one and a used one.  The new one still has excessive play in the main joint where the plastic pivot head is connected to the metal shaftNote 3:  the small cover on the handle-end had popped off my original one.  I needed to put a self-tapping screw into the shaft to hold that cover in place.Note 4:  Seems that the company noticed that small cover popped off on the earlier models, so they are using a different cover on the newer models.  Still didn't solve the issue of the shaft having free play =(Please, if anyone can make a better suggestion on a telescoping monopod, that 1 - does not rotate along the shaft,  2 - no free play in the shaft and/or joints to prevent shaking (by use of locking joints or anything!),  3 - can fit in a pocket when retracted... PLEASE let me know.  I've been looking for one for the last 2 years and still have not found a suitable product.  The only ones I can find that have the locking shaft are regular sized monopods (minimum of 20") which are not pocket sized!

Reviews.Title: Pocket Xshot
Reviews.Author: Karen Ann Osborne
Reviews.Content: Anyone who owns a compact camera should own a Pocket Xshot. The features of the Pocket Xshot are already listed in Amazon's blurb so here are a few things they forgot to mention. First, this thing really works! You don't need a mirror to place yourself in the shot, just look in the lens. My husband, father-in-law, and 12 year old daughter all took well centered photos after one or two attempts.There are two groves, one on each side, of the telescoping metal of the Pocket Xshot. The groves serve to keep the device stable and prevent your camera from turning upside down as you get ready for your shot. My brother's camera extender did not perform as well.The Pocket Xshot is so small it fits easily in my purse attached to my camera. It is so light weight anyone can hold the camera upright for as long as it takes to get the perfect shot.The best thing about the Pocket Xshot is that it keeps unwanted people out of your photos. Stand in front of your chosen background and extend your camera on the Xshot. Pedestrian traffic will naturally flow around you and your camera. The Pocket Xshot eliminates the need to wait forever or ask people to stand back while you get the perfect shot.Since receiving my Pocket Xshot, I have ordered two more as gifts. You know the people who are never in the picture because they are always taking the picture? There seems to be one in every family. The ones in my family will be losing their excuse very soon. I unreservedly give this product five stars.

Reviews.Title: Go easy with it.
Reviews.Author: Superdave
Reviews.Content: First day I got it I could not wait to put it on my new GoPro...I guess I pulled on it a little too hard because it came apart in the middle.It was hard to get back together but I did.(now I know better)Now it works great. So,...go easy.

Reviews.Title: Not For Canon Cameras
Reviews.Author: D. Steinberg
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this product.  I thought it was a fabulous idea and was looking forward to being in my pictures.  Unfortunately, it just doesn't work with Canon cameras.  I own three different models and I couldn't get it to work with any of them.  Very disappointing.Easy return though!  Amazon let me print a label and my full refund was back in my account in just about a week.  Thanks for that Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Great gadget!
Reviews.Author: Mike Shea "The Goob"
Reviews.Content: I bought this mainly to use with my Go Pro HD Hero action cam. This thing was made for that camera!!! I have put other compacts on it with great results. Quite sturdy, fairly well made for something that is roughly $20!! High over crowd shots, hanging over ledge shots, self portraits. Just use your imagination and you will think of a few more. Mine goes everywhere the camera goes. It's small enough to carry anywhere. A couple of friends liked mine so much they are now proud owners. I use it more than you might think. Buy it!

Reviews.Title: Genius Product
Reviews.Author: John Hagge
Reviews.Content: For anyone who has or is planning to travel alone and take lots of pictures, this is a must have!First the construction.  Based on other reviews and other websites, I expected the sturdiness of this product to be marginal.  I also expected it to be feather light.  The product has some density to it, because it is made out of VERY sturdy metal.  I applied pressure to see how easy it is to bend and was unable to bend it.  Even at the narrow end, it is very wisely constructed.  Each piece is circular in shape, but has divots which add structural support.  The camera mount itself is very nice, it attaches easily without having to fumble with a coin or screwdriver like many tripods.  The angle of the camera in relation to the metal arm is also adjusable from 0 degrees to 130 degrees.  The lanyard is very nice if you just want it to dangle from your wrist like many people do with their point and shoot camera.Now the usability.  This product does exactly what it is designed to do.  It is simple to install the camera on it without using extra tools.  When ready, it extends to full length.  The until I bought is the 30" unit.  I am about 6 feet tall, so this is pretty short, but collapsed it measures less than 6 inches, which makes it functional and discreet.  Another use of the product is that it makes a great handle for the camera.  If you are like me and occasionally (accidentally) thumb over the flash, use this device in the collapsed position as a handle.I usually travel alone, so this certainly beats having to ask random strangers for help taking a picture.  It also alleviates the risk of handing your camera to someone and having it stolen.  It took my two tries to get it to work to my desire, and the majority of the struggle was with my camera!Even if you don't travel alone, this is great for the person who is always behind the camera and never in the picture.  Trust me, this is an essential tool you will never travel without again!

Reviews.Title: Doesn't screw into my camera
Reviews.Author: Chuck Nibbana
Reviews.Content: I was very excited with this item arrived but immediately dissappointed when I tried to screw it into the base of my Canon camera and the bolt wouldn't go in. After several attempts, I went and got my other two tripods and they screwed in without any hassle. I compared the threads on the different tripods and noticed the XShot had a significantly steeper thread pitch than my other tripods. I'm surprised others haven't experienced a similary issue and am saddened I have to return it because otherwise it is a well made product.

Reviews.Title: XShot Pocket Telescopic Camera Extender model XSP1
Reviews.Author: CJMORE
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews here I was unclear if this product (XShot Pocket Telescopic Camera Extender model XSP1 ) would work with the Canon, Nikon or Panasonic compact cameras.Let me clear up some confusion from the comments below the short answer is YES without any issue or additional parts.Here are a couple cameras I know work with this product.PowerShot ELPH 300 HSNikon Coolpix P300Panasonic ZS8That said, this is a great little product for all the self photographers out there.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for (maybe less)
Reviews.Author: xinger
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my go-pro for snowboarding.You really get what you pay for or less. Since this is something I will never ever use again, then I did pay too much. Now it's just taking up space in my storage room.The hinge & tilt mechanism is poorly designed and does not reliably sustain the weight of my gopro camera. The screw mechanism feels like it's gonna break if I tightened it too much.It really makes me wonder...how would anyone be able to use this to hold a full size digital camera?The extension rod also feels cheap and I know it will break if I wiped out while boarding.Would not recommend it for any outdoor related activities. Spend 20-30 bucks more and get a good one. Too bad I haven't found a better one on Amazon yet.

Reviews.Title: Does not use industry standard mounting screw
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: As a few other people have stated, this product does not use a standard mounting screw size. Because of this it will not work at all with any of my cameras (I only have Canon cameras, but am surprised that it works with other cameras since the mounting screw size is pretty much universal). I have several other tripods and monopods and all work perfectly with my cameras, but the xshot obviously uses a different thread pitch than normal and thus will not screw into the camera at all. Interestingly enough though is that the bottom hole on the xshot (which you can use to attach the xshot itself to a tripod) seems to use the standard thread pitching as I can attach the xshot itself to my existing tripod with no problem.This seems to be a great product if I could actually mount a camera to it... because of this significant flaw it is useless to me and will be going back.UPDATE: I also tried this device with a Sony HX7V camera and the screw is also the wrong size for that camera. I'm not sure what cameras all these other reviewers are able to get working with this device.

Reviews.Title: Works as intended
Reviews.Author: Zoomie888 "Zoomie888"
Reviews.Content: I read pretty much all the reviews and then most of the competitor's ones too and found this one was highly rated b/c the telescoping section has a groove that prevents it from swiveling. This is a feature others don't have which makes the XShot superior.The first one I ordered came loose and all footage got rattly. I informed Xshot and though they were not able to replace it, they did give me a complete refund with shipping both ways. I then just repurchased another one again from Amazon and it's been working well. Glue may have fixed the old one and I'll probably do that with this second one if the bracket ever comes loose again. For the time being it's working well.I use this on my Kodak Play Sport ZX3. A great matching product to the XShot is a mini fisheye wide angle lens designed for flip cams and mobile phones. Highly recommended.WHY I BOUGHT THE XSHOT:I already mentioned why I got this one specifically. I purchased this type of product for action shots while riding on a recumbent tricycle. I wanted to be able to get close shots and others at weird angles. This camera extension does the trick.HOW I USE IT:Extending it facing away, I can ride alongside other riders and get very close shots of their trike's components. I wouldn't be able to reach over and do this otherwise. I can also use this with the camera facing myself for shots this gizmo was intended for. I can also use it to extend upwards and get shots downward of crowds. People will always look up and smile wondering what that thing is!TIPS:1. Yes, it fits in the back of a cycling jersey.2. Match your camera with a neck strap and you'll have it ready to go and still be handsfree in the meantime.3. Get the fish eye lens to go with it.4. Mount the camera at an angle to the length of the extension pole and you can avoid getting your arm in the shot. It'll truly look like someone else took the video for you while doing self shots.

Reviews.Title: Just Too Many Issues
Reviews.Author: Tim Jones
Reviews.Content: Originally purchased this as a replacement for an old XShot (full size).  It is my third XShot and I'm really disappointed in this one after being so happy with my previous two.  The first one I received had a tripod screw that would not fit any of my cameras and I've noted that this is mentioned in other reviews.  I sent that one back and got a new one that had the proper screw.Well, after less than a week of very light use the platform that the camera sits on began to wobble, causing shaky video and concern that my camera will fall and the telescoping rods came apart!  I managed to get them back together, but this has been a continual issue for me with this XShot.  I intended to send it back, but have too busy traveling (and not using my XShot, as intended) to get it back to them.Really wanted to like this one, especially for it's size.  Seems that XShot still has some kinks to work out.

Reviews.Title: Cheap and faulty, gopro user.
Reviews.Author: MattDurr
Reviews.Content: Basically, I use it 3 times before the telescopic extenders came apart, the black handle came off the second time I used it. This thing is a sham. I was excited to finally use it for my GOPRO HERO camera, but it was short lived.

Reviews.Title: Great camera bag item!
Reviews.Author: jedi008 "jedi_008"
Reviews.Content: This item was made for the GoPro camera!  But it will work well for any small pocket camera that has either a delay shutter or remote shutter option.  I can see using this to get shots where I want some height such as above heads in a crowd or where I cannot stand such as out a window.  While it is not a high end quality item, it is well worth the inexpensive price.  I can see using this handy item many times!

Reviews.Title: Great device!
Reviews.Author: Pavel
Reviews.Content: Small weight and size. Not so cool materials and construction but very nice and usefully.The profile of tubes of the extender not round and thanks to it a camera isn't turned around!I can safely recommend to buy this product.

Reviews.Title: my problems with the item
Reviews.Author: Charles M Ehmann
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my gopro.  When I mounted my gopro camera on it, it jiggled.  That is, the piece that screws into the camera had play, so when I would move my hand ever so slightly, the camera would jiggle, which is useless for filming.  No amount of tightening would fix that.  I had to take it apart and superglue one of the pieces so it would not jiggle.  That fixed the problem.On my first outing kitesurfing, the strap ripped out, along with the stopper piece at the bottom.  Fortunately, I was in shallow water.  It's just flimsy, there is no screws holding in the stopper, its just pressed in.  Any amount of pull, and it will come out.This device is not meant for the rigors of kitesurfing.  If they'd spend a couple dollars more in manufacturing, they'd have a product worthy for use in sports by fixing the jiggle, and make the strap 10x stronger, as well as the stopper at the bottom.Use it for a parade, not for high speed aggressive sports where you are trying to film yourself.

Reviews.Title: Cheaply made and faulty, do not use for GoPro!
Reviews.Author: James Hood
Reviews.Content: Bought this to film on my GoPro. The top part (where the camera mounts) is all plastic and uses a very small wood screw to hold the stability of the camera mount. It was loose from the moment I opened the packaging and fell apart in seconds. The wood screw stripped the plastic and actually slid right out of the plastic housing making any all camera motion rattling. Saw this issue in many reviews and ignored it. Don't ingore this because it seems to be very consistant. If you have a GoPro, know that this is perfect for it, but fails because it's design and material sucks.Fortunately, through amazon, I was able to return the item and get a full refund.

Reviews.Title: Only  use with the lightest cameras.
Reviews.Author: AWBoater
Reviews.Content: I bought this item as it seemed more heavy duty than most of this type item, and I liked that the shaft was "indexed" so that it doesn't twist like other versions.However, the mounting base (the part that screws into the camera) is a bit weak, given that the rest of the construction seems well made and heavy duty.Unfortunately, the screws that hold the two pieces of the mounting base together are too small, and when I put my larger compact camera (Nikon P7000) on it, the pieces started to separate. This would have eventually led to the camera falling off the mount - not good.I was able to fix the weak mount by using slightly larger screws, and so far it seems to work OK.Now while the Nikon P7000 is a larger and heavier compact camera - it is still a compact camera, and weighs in at 12oz.  In comparison, I have a Nikon S570 that weighs 5oz, and an Olympus Tough 8010 that is 8oz. So while the P7000 is on the heavy side, I would not say it is out of the ballpark in camera weights.So if you are to use this item, make sure you only use it on the lightest cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great concept, poor quality.
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I was super excited when I found this product. The design was exactly what I was looking for, a colapseable pole I could use with my Gopro for snowboarding and fit in my pocket when not in use.When it arrived at my house the first thing I noticed is that the XShot felt rather flimsy and there is a good deal of play in the shaft when extended, even under the light weight of a Gopro. The metal used in the pole seems a little thin and this is likely the cause of the flimsy feeling.  By thickening the sidewalls of the pole they could make the product much sturdier without increasing its size significantly.Also, the XShot Pocket comes with an adjustable hinge on the end of the pole allowing you to adjust the camera angle up and down.  This would be a nice feature with other cameras, but the Gopro tripod mount (which must be used to attach the Gopro) does the same thing.  Having two hinges adds to the overall length of the pole, making it harder to fit in your pocket, and adds to the slop in the pole. Making this hinge removeable would have been a nice feature.  The material this hinge is made of is a lightweight plastic, and it cracked within the first day of use just under the weight of the camera (no drops or falls).  With some epoxy the XShot was again useable, but the crack continued to spread and required regluing.The third day of using the polecam two sections of the pole broke apart in my hand while I was snowboarding (again just riding, no jumps, falls, or drops).  This seems to go back to the thin metal used in the shaft.  After having this product for less than a week and having it break in two seperate instances with no abuse I was a little frustrated.Again, the concept of the product is great.  With a couple of small tweaks to the design and improving the quality of materials XShot would have a perfect product on their hands at a reasonable price.  However, as is the XShot is a bit too fragile, esppecially for being marketed as being intended for use in sporting events.

Reviews.Title: Broken within 5 minutes of use
Reviews.Author: C. Hummels
Reviews.Content: I received this for Christmas.  I was very excited to use it, and attached it to my canon S95 (tiny camera).  It broke within 5 minutes, when I went to disconnect the camera from the pod.  The plastic attachment piece is VERY shoddy, and the screws that glue into it are super cheap.  Do not bother buying this until they upgrade the connector piece to something stronger like aluminum.

Reviews.Title: Mount head jiggles loose, unusable
Reviews.Author: Jonathan M. Davis
Reviews.Content: I was trying to get into vlogging. I really liked this thing when I pulled it from its packaging, and was very impressed by its quality and its build. But then I mounted my camera. I have a Sony NEX-5 with a "pancake" lens--a bit on the heavy side but nothing a good monopod shouldn't be able to handle. It mounted "fine" and everything worked "fine", but then when I hit "Record" on the camera I noticed it wouldn't hold still, the whole camera wobbled back and forth on the mount. It literally rocked back and forth as I held it out.It turns out that there are two pieces on the head of this thing, the piece that connects to the extendable monopod handle and also exposes a screw grip to spin the attachment screw, and the piece of plastic that holds the screw into place. This plastic plate thing is rather crappily joined and is loose with no way to tighten it. The whole thing would be fine if I wasn't moving around but I do move around, that's what a handheld monopod is for, duh. So there'd be no getting around the rocking.I literally have to throw this away--it's too cheap to try to resell it or otherwise hassle with a return or somesuch, but too expensive not to note the loss here. This is so completely disappointing!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for a GoPro initially, but lacks the ruggedness
Reviews.Author: HappyDad "happydad88"
Reviews.Content: I bought this (along with a GoPro tripod mount adapter) primarily for my GoPro Hero helmet cam for use in skiing and snowboarding.  I immediately enjoyed its ability to collapse and extend when needed, so that makes it very portable on the slopes.  However, after some use, the plastic area holding the threaded screw mount & thumb wheel developed a slight play in it.  As a result, this slight play/wobble is causing shakiness in my GoPro shots and videos.  To be fair I'm sure this is made for a less rugged and agressive use like casual point-and-shoot camera during travel trips, but just a heads-up for those of you thinking of buying this for your GoPro like I did.Update: the rubberized pad where the camera sits came off, and now I see that there are 2 screws keeping the top plastic and tightening nut together.  Now this explains where the slight play I noted above was coming from.  Over time, the weight of the camera rocking on the mount causes the plastic piece to wear away against the screws, thus the play.  There is a fix for this which is to tighten the screws yourself, or buy longer screws if the threads on the plastics are shot.  However, the design flaw (IMO) here is that the screws should have been a bolt-and-nut setup vs. just screws. Now that I know they are screws, I WILL NOT use it for my expensive cameras again as they can fail anytime.  A bolt-and-nut setup would have been more secure as it is metal to metal hold the plastics pieces together.  Let me know if anyone wants to see a picture/video of what I'm talking about I can upload one.

Reviews.Title: End cap easily comes off
Reviews.Author: jimintexas
Reviews.Content: The bottom cap of the Xshot came off easily. I was a bit suspicious when the package I received the Xshot seemed to open easily (ie, could have been a returned item), so I don't know if it was a faulty one or if this is typical of the construction quality, but it is a potential hazard for your camera to then put the Xshot on a tripod based on this faulty end cap.  While I had the Xshot on the tripod, the Xshot fell off (with the end cap stayed on the tripod) and the Xshot (camera and all) fell to the ground. Fortunately, it fell on soft carpet, so there was no damage to the camera. Anyway, am in process of trying to return it to Semsons (which I bought through Amazon).

Reviews.Title: Banish the Bad Selfie
Reviews.Author: Reader Rabbit "private_storm"
Reviews.Content: As a frequent solo traveler this thing has truly changed my life and photo capturing of my trips. It attaches to any point and shoot compact camera. It gets the whole background and not just arms length. I don't have to worry about asking strangers to take my pictures when I am traveling anymore. I have used this all over the world and have captured Big Ben and the Disney Castle in the background. It is a bit long but will fit in your pocket. When I am taking a lot of solo pics, I go ahead and just leave the camera attached.I have the Samsung camera with the screen on the front which helps to frame pictures once I extend the pod. I set the timer and off I go. Picture is taken and i am on the move again. People stop me all the time to take a look at it.

Reviews.Title: Good GoPro dive monopod
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I just got done using it with my GoPro H2 for diving in Cozumel. It has worked very well in saltwater and has held up over 32 dives in 13 days with only an occasional fresh water rinse, no signs of corrosion and the action is still tight and firm. Got a tip from a professional photographer about 4 days into the trip to select inverted video mode on the camera and to hold it with the camera hanging down while diving, this naturally lessens the 'jiteryness' of the video and greatly improves the balance. I sold the rig with dive housing to a refugee from Canukastan who is staying and diving through the next week and will order another replacement rig when I get home.

Reviews.Title: Decent for GoPro or Contour
Reviews.Author: sinister2c
Reviews.Content: I got this for a snowboarding trip, it was under $20 so worth it for self videos.The build is somewhat flimsy.  The head and screws broke off on me after the first day.  I ended up super gluing the screws and head it and it holds good now.  Also had to glue the rubber pad onto the head so it wouldn't twist when tightening the camera on.  The glue they use is crappy.Th extension between the handle and rest of the unit also fell off on me on the mountain.  Metal contracts so the tubes and copper spacers don't hold tight in 20F temps.  I ended up sticking the tube back in and saved the copper spacers to fix later.  It was a POA to put the copper spacers back in at room temp, had to freeze the spacers and unit to contract the metal to get it back in.

Reviews.Title: Very cheap
Reviews.Author: Miller
Reviews.Content: Made very cheaply.  All plastic with metal screws holding it together.  My camera wabbled and made it difficult to take good pics and the screws stripped out within 2 weeks.

Reviews.Title: So-So
Reviews.Author: Todd A. Waller
Reviews.Content: The telescoping shaft is great.  No side to side rotation, very strong, and doesn't collapse, all while skiing in bumps and crud.  The grip and wrist strap are great too.HOWEVER, the head is flimsy and junk.  Lots of play even out of the box.  The forward and back AND rotating play is really bad while bumping around on skis.  If you are just going to stand still and video, then no play.  The rubber piece that is supposed to lock down the female screw-on camera to the male screw of the monopod WILL fall off on you, leaving a loose connection.  You can try to rig up some concoction in place of the rubber part, but just know the head will have a lot of play no matter what you do.  It looks like the play is due to little gears that provide stops from going out of the range of motion, but the play occurs within the range of motion.  It's like the effect you get from a child-safe prescription bottle cap - it will have play with a side-to-side twist and you can move it up and down, but its on there pretty good.With that said, I am never afraid of the camera separating from the monopod while skiing with my GoPro (a big fear among all of us).  Also, the Xshot fits in my ski pants pocket great, with the GoPro camera zipped on the outside.  After bumping around, jumping, and skiing hard, the camera stayed in my pocket all day, although sometimes annoying me when my elbow collided with it.  The resulting video, while I was moving on skis, is bouncy, unstable, and tons of vibration.  When I stopped to film buddies, I got a nice stable picture.  If you can't wait for another version that will hopefully correct the head play issues, and you need one NOW, buy it.  It is another great item to add to your GoPro quiver of chest straps and mounts, but I will be replacing this eventually, when I see one that's a better option.

Reviews.Title: Not greatest quality
Reviews.Author: Kretschmann
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my GoPro camera and after I first got it, the connecting piece on top was wobbly and eventually broke off, so I had to put new screws into it, as well as one to hold the top plastic piece to where it meets the metal. Now this last week when I took it snowboarding the handle pulled out of its socket. Not the greatest quality for action camera use unless you're guaranteed not put a lot of stress on it the different components.

Reviews.Title: Pocket Xshot
Reviews.Author: Cameron McKenna
Reviews.Content: When I first received the item it appeared to have been opened and used before. There were some obvious marks that showed that the product had been minorly used. Being my self I didn't return it. The day after I got it we went cross country skiing and I didn't fall once however when extended it part of the base broke off. Thankfully I was able to hot glue it back together and it works the way it was advertised. The only reason why I didn't give one star was because I was still able to use it. I wouldn't recommend this product to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Sergio M
Reviews.Content: After about three trials, the camera was posted at the right angle for our fishing trip photos. Using the fully extended arm, the camera captured all of us and a good batch of background as well, we were on a small motor boat. It worked great on the video mode too. It is like another person taking the pictures and videos. Overall, it was an excellent buy.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the ones who travel alone!
Reviews.Author: nadiape
Reviews.Content: This is a great idea as a tool to help you to take pictures of you with out asking someone to take it for you.It screw perfect in my Canon PowerShot it fit my camera bag in a nice way, help you to BE in the pictures!When i bought it and showed to my relatives they were amazed with this pocket tool!I really recomend it to have it as a accesory for your camera!

Reviews.Title: Must have for camera bag!
Reviews.Author: Jim A.
Reviews.Content: I use this for many of our pics to get us both in the same photo.  Works perfect with my Samsung dual view camera.  Now I don't have my arm stretched out in every self photo.  Plus, no need to ever ask someone to take our picture.  Especially useful when there isn't anyone to ask.  Small enough to fit in my pants or jacket pocket and I think is a must have for your camera bag.  I haven't had any problems with it.  The quality seems good and sturdy.  I'd recommend it!

Reviews.Title: XShot camera extender
Reviews.Author: broray39
Reviews.Content: The XShot is very handy for me and my wife when there's no one to take our picture together.  It is very compact, and the grooved telescope shaft provides excellent stability.  The adjustable head also provides an infinite variety of camera angles.  Very well pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great--with one minor warning
Reviews.Author: T. Arnold "The great enemy of clear language ...
Reviews.Content: I use the xShot extender with the matching iPhone 4 case, and it is great.  Easy to use, well made, portable--it is everything I was looking for.  I finally have vacation pics with me in them!  This is the perfect gadget for solo travelers--or even those who like to have 'together' pics without handing off their camera to a stranger (or for those traveling to remote areas where strangers are unavailable!)However, I have one warning--it's not a negative aspect, just something to think about.  I purchased this mainly for use when traveling; I am one of those 'light packing' people, so I never check a bag.  On my most recent trip--my first trip with this extender--I was stopped at security in both directions because of how it showed up in the xray.  It wasn't an issue--in fact, the woman at the first airport was betting her coworker that it was a telescope and laughed when I showed her what it was.  Just know that if you are planning on packing it in a carry on, you should put it somewhere easily accessible, and perhaps pull it out to place with your electronics to avoid a possible hold up.

Reviews.Title: WARNING: No GoPro Tripod mount!
Reviews.Author: kbern "live to ride"
Reviews.Content: I can't really fault this item for having a GoPro tripod mount adapter, but just FYI, the GoPro does *NOT* come with a tripod mount... that's an accessory you have to buy separately, so you may want to buy that at the same time as this: GoPro Tripod Mount for HERO CamerasOther than that, this thing is awesomely small and light and seems very well made... can't wait to try it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera accessory.
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: Used it last week on a trip and it worked perfectly for getting those impromptu "here we are in front of _____" snapshots with everyone in the picture. Lots of plastic parts, but good for recreational use with a light weight pocket camera.

Reviews.Author: Samuel Sanchez

Reviews.Title: Works well with Casio Exilim P&S; Camera & Canon G12
Reviews.Author: John "John"
Reviews.Content: Heavier than I expect it to be but that's good because it also means it's not flimsy as I expected it to be. When you put the camera on the end it doesn't feel like the XShot isn't strong enough.Telescoping the XShot is easier than retracting it back. It feels solid performing either activity so I don't feel like I'll break it either way.I can't say I would call this pocket size though unless you are wearing cargo shorts or a large jacket.I read a number of reviews saying this does not work with a Canon camera. I found my Canon G12 and it works without issues.

Reviews.Title: Must Have for Your Voyage
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling abroad, this little device is a must have. Sure, you can ask some other tourist to snap a photo of you and your travel companion(s) while standing in front of the Eiffel Tower. But what if no one else is around?I kept this thing in my back pocket at all times while my wife and I traveled in Europe. I attached my camera, extended the device, set the timer, and held the Telescopic Camera Extender, while my wife composed the shot on the camera's LCD screen. We got some excellent results. And we got many thumbs up and smiles from other travelers.

Reviews.Title: great for taking pics when no one else is around to do it
Reviews.Author: nan
Reviews.Content: bought this for my daughter who was with her fiance in the military but was never able to send pics because they were alone.  Now they get to take a few pics together, to have once he is deployed.

Reviews.Title: Works with Canon G16 without any problem!!! :)
Reviews.Author: Priyanka Sharma
Reviews.Content: It works with my new Canon G16 without any problem. Also, since it has grooves, it wont let camera rotate downwards - that was my concern because I read other similar products reviews and many of them complain about rotation. Since Canon G16 is bit heavier camera, having grooves solves rotation problem (upside down) very well.Sleek, lightweight and easy to carry (can be carried in ladies handbag). What else you can ask from a tiny device like this.

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised!
Reviews.Author: Karunacompass
Reviews.Content: Very handy, tiny when collapsed. Haven't put it through much rough use, so I'll update this when I do. Very glad I bought it!

Reviews.Title: Poor quality
Reviews.Author: Paula Echeverry
Reviews.Content: I used this item twice, on the second time while adjusting the camera for tilt, the pole broke at the end. The metal is really thin so if you drop it or or put force while adjusting your camera it will most likely brake. I contacted the seller who said i would have to contact the manufacturer if i wanted a refund, go figure.

Reviews.Title: Seems solid . . .
Reviews.Author: Matthew Ellis
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my brother but got to check it out when he opened it. It looked well put together and sturdy. If I was in the market for one myself, this is the one I would get.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: H. M. Castro
Reviews.Content: Love this item when paired with a GoPro. It has a tripod mount which I did not expect and a handy strap.

Reviews.Title: Everyone complements
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Ross
Reviews.Content: Felt a little silly at first, but everyone that sees me use it thinks it's awesome.  Sort of awkward to  keep on camera all the time

Reviews.Title: feel great in my hands, i like how it works with my camera
Reviews.Author: Randal
Reviews.Content: it fits great with my Sony extreme camera.I like how It feels in my hand when I go for a walk or run.

Reviews.Title: Built of good quality materials, and weighted right for a normal camera
Reviews.Author: LordRybo "- Rybo"
Reviews.Content: Just a little heavy for what it is, but this is because of some extremely good quality materials that were put into it.  For my cell phone (Nokia Lumia 1020) that I use this with, the base is a little too heavy.  If you had a more common camera on the end of it, the balance might be a little bit better.

Reviews.Title: A great tool for a super camera!
Reviews.Author: PhotoJim
Reviews.Content: Great tool to use with my GoPro Hero camera...  I can shhot video from a high position over crowds and reach into some difficult places and STILL GET THE SHOT!

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Martin
Reviews.Content: Excellent is a very nice product.Is perfect.Im very happy with this article and i recomed for any people.

Reviews.Title: Perfect size
Reviews.Author: expman
Reviews.Content: Even though this is the shorter of the 2, the length is perfect and easy to maneuver around with the gopro H3.

Reviews.Title: Okay
Reviews.Author: Devildoc
Reviews.Content: I use this with my gopro3, I playback video and there are a lot of clicking sound when used with the xshot specially with movement. Not bad when you are music over the sound. Great for those hard to get low/high shots, over crowds, etc.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: OMG
Reviews.Content: Quality is good, works a described and light and compact enough to drop in your purse, maybe wish it was a little more compact.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Keith E. Finger
Reviews.Content: Used this with a small Panasonic P&S; while hiking for a week. I kept the camera on the monopod and put it my hiking shorts.  It was very light. My only observation for making the most of it is that you'll probably take two shot each time, since you'll likely make adjustments after the first shot to make sure the photo is framed as you'd like. A camera with a 28mm lens (or equiivalent) works best.

Reviews.Title: good for panaramic pics
Reviews.Author: William C. Milo "Bill Milo"
Reviews.Content: When sitting at a table I can get everyone in with a panoramic picture with this.  The only con is that I sometimes forget to carryit.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for everyday use
Reviews.Author: David Hoff
Reviews.Content: The XShot XSP1 is a perfect low budget solution for everyday use. It's very light, but sturdy feeling at the same time. I read plenty of reviews before purchasing that address the plastic hardware being a bit sloppy (over time getting worse) and find this to be somewhat true, but it's also a very inexpensive product, and I don't expect it to be in my bag for more than a couple of years anyway. It's exactly what I was expecting, and has already come in handy more than once.

Reviews.Title: It's not really 6 ft-_______-
Reviews.Author: abraham n.
Reviews.Content: I was expecting 6.8 feet but it was only about 3. They shouldn't lie to the buyer about howl long this thing extends-______-

Reviews.Title: I love this Monopod!
Reviews.Author: Dani
Reviews.Content: Very useful to have this monopod on your walks! I am going to use it often and then I will be able to write more reviews. Currently I am happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Sweet Tool for the GoPro!
Reviews.Author: Mitch Tracey
Reviews.Content: This product is a great addition to use with the GoPro or any camera of your choice!  I love the durability of it too!

Reviews.Title: Nice product
Reviews.Author: Ricardo
Reviews.Content: This product really met my expectations. You can get shots from different angles and it is very useful for a lot of different situations.

Reviews.Title: Great for non-action stuff
Reviews.Author: loki_racer
Reviews.Content: Fits in a pocket.  Holds a GoPro.The biggest negative is that plastic parts were used on the screw/thumb lock.  It makes it really hard to actually tighten down the camera screw/mount.  I've heard the plastic crack while trying to tighten it, which makes me nervous.Overall it does a great job for most stuff.I would have given five stars if that thumb screw wasn't plastic.

Reviews.Title: Pocket Extendable Hand Held Monopod
Reviews.Author: wolf
Reviews.Content: Pocket Extendable Hand Held Monopod is very awesome. My son in low played all day long filming himself with Pocket Extendable Hand Held Monopod

Reviews.Title: Camera extender
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my husband who loves gadgets...we will be going on a extended trip next year so I packed it up with our location in map letters...

Reviews.Title: Very Handy
Reviews.Author: Marcelo A. De Souza
Reviews.Content: It's a must if you own a GoPro. The head could have a better fix for the nut, it loose after some movement...

Reviews.Title: Extrndable hand held mono!
Reviews.Author: Patrick Conlan
Reviews.Content: Yeah, works just like it should, I was assuming it would be a little longer, but I'm not sure if i really need it to be. fun to play around with, seems like a strong stable item. i have no fear putting my gopro on this thing, (you will need a tripod connector for your gopro.)

Reviews.Title: Compact and lite wieght
Reviews.Author: S. Richards
Reviews.Content: Compact, and fits in a backpack easily. telescopes out to 3 feet. Not made for a lot of wieght but is perfect for a point and shoot camera or any of the Go-Pros

Reviews.Title: Works well for the money
Reviews.Author: SideShowJohn
Reviews.Content: This monopod works well for the price I paid. Extends, adjusts, easy to use for the most part. It feels 60-70% solid, but I imagine you could find a more top of line unit. You have to work it a bit to tighten everything just the right amount.

Reviews.Title: Great vacation addition
Reviews.Author: Joseph L. Sarianides
Reviews.Content: Works great on vacation, now we don't have to ask people to take our picture all the time.  We recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: A perfectly designed and light-weight product
Reviews.Author: K. K. Fung
Reviews.Content: I have seen some tourists who prefer to use this gadget to put themselves into the picture even when they could easily ask for help. I have been skeptical of how good the pictures could be until I tried it with this monopod. It is always better to have help from an experienced photographer, but most tourists are quite hopeless in framing pictures. So this product is a god-send. It is also useful for shooting from low and other unusual angles.

Reviews.Title: Works well.  Inexpensive
Reviews.Author: Charles G. Braden Jr.
Reviews.Content: Does exactly as advertised.  Great for picturs when no one else is around to take them or everyone looks like a potential camera thief.

Reviews.Title: excellent for traveling
Reviews.Author: rlsz
Reviews.Content: This works great!  It took me only 3 tries before I had figured out just how to hold it and angle the camera to get the shot I wanted.  There is no button on the handle to trigger the camera (though that would be incredible if they could do it), so just set the timer and smile.  I'll admit, I felt really silly the first time I used it and I got some strange looks.  But once I saw how much better the photos were with the extra distance between me and the camera, it's totally worth having one or two people look at you funny.  It is quite compact when it's collapsed and I can easily fit it (and my point and shoot camera) into one of my smaller purses, so it's discreet when I don't need it, but easy to carry with me for when I do.  And it is really quite sturdy, not at all cheap or flimsy.  Also great for hiking - you can stick it up in the air to get a better view or stick it over the edge of a cliff for a neat perspective (without having to stick you head over!).  Just a great, quality product at a great price.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Paola Leon-Ferre
Reviews.Content: love it! super good and lightweight, small , very portable! fits in my coolpix nikon i'm so happy with the purchase

Reviews.Title: Great Concept, Flawed Implementation
Reviews.Author: The Den
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this product idea, and it was mostly a great product... however, the plastic head is truly garbage... it had a hard time locking and doesn't really hold the camera very well... also after a week or so, I had the grip sliding off as I extend/contract the handle sometimes.  It would slide back, but a bit of a nuissance.  I'm looking forward to the "pro" version of this, which will hopefully fix the head issues.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera accessory
Reviews.Author: Tommi Wetherald "TomW"
Reviews.Content: got this for my GoPro HD HERO2: Motorsports Edition (2011 Model) along with a GoPro Tripod Mount for HERO Cameras.The description is pretty good for what this does. You can handhold the camera and put yourself in the shot.You can do overhead shots if you're at an event and you're standing in the crowd.My favorite though is to do low angle shots of pets. I put the hero in upside down mode, and hold the camera close to the ground to get shots of them at their level.other than that the product is pretty solid, the grooves are a must have, otherwise the camera could swivel around and make it harder to line up your shots.There is also another tripod mount screw on the bottom, so you could attach it to a clamp, another tripod or monopod if you needed mounting or even more reach.

Reviews.Title: Just about perfect- and fun!
Reviews.Author: Michael C. O'Brien
Reviews.Content: My Pocket Xshot just came in the mail..and I've been goofing off with it for about an hour! It's really cool because you can get some great angles with it, and especially if your camera shoots hd video, all of a sudden you can shoot great movies-- well, at least they entertain me..So, to get to the review, it fits in your pocket nicely, it extends to about 2 feet(guessing- I forgot to read the specs before I started writing), the sections are nice and snug so it won't collapse on you once it's open. It threads 1/4 twenty female adapters, so it should fit most cameras. I have a Canon Powershot SD940 IS and it works great with it. I also have a Drift 170 Stealth videocamera which I use for mounting on my motorcycle, and it works with that as well, and that's a bulkier camera. No problems holding it. I will say though, that the mounting fixture on the end is only plastic, which scares me a bit as far as durability. i don't know if I'll mount this to my motorcycle adapter, I'd be scared it couldn't take the high speed force. I could be wrong. Maybe in the future they could modify it with more metal parts, but that would make a heavier product to carry around.I will say that I noticed some audio noise from the movement of the plastic parts- there's some slight play between the metal sleeve and where the plastic inserts into it. My videocamera picked up the noise pretty clearly so it killed any audio dialogue I was hoping for, but I didn't hear it when I shot HD with my still camera. Could be where the mics are mounted, but I still wish it fit more snugly together.As far as the positioning, there are only two options- the hinged locking pin lets you move the camera forward and backward, and depending on which way you tighten down your camera, you can get the other angles you need. The only thing that could be scary is that the rubber shoe that butts up to the bottom of your camera is only a rectangular shape of about 1/2 inch wide by 1 1/4 inch long. Looks like it was designed to only sit long-ways under your camera, so if you turned it sideways you wouldn't have as much support. It still works but I'd be careful. Do some testing before you stick it out over the Grand Canyon!That's about all I can say right now. I'll keep messing with it and report more if I find any faults, but I'd say for the money it's a great buy that allows you many possibilities and options for fans of photography and film making.Hope this helped you, enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Luv it...
Reviews.Author: CycleBabe
Reviews.Content: I received my Pocket Xspot & tried it in my camera it was so cool & can't wait to start using it especially this coming summer for our road trip & hikings ;-)

Reviews.Title: Handy, but a leeeetle flimsy
Reviews.Author: M. Hagans
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my husband to use with this GoPro. Once he attached the GoPro tripod mount, it worked out. We received the shipment quickly, and the seller is great. I think my husband will get a lot of use out of this gadget, but he will need to be gentler with it than he would with a stronger monopod.

Reviews.Title: Good to have with Go Pro
Reviews.Author: 03ephatch
Reviews.Content: I used this item with my Go Pro Hero. It seemed a bit unstable & it felt like the extender was going to come apart, but it didn't. I also used a string to attach the camera to my wrist just in case. Overall, this product is decent.

Reviews.Title: great item
Reviews.Author: Alexander L. Durante
Reviews.Content: This item was a gift and I have heard nothing but good things about it.  I would recommend this item to anyone who is a solo traveler

Reviews.Title: Small but versitile!
Reviews.Author: PhotoGuy
Reviews.Content: This product works great on light-weight cameras. It's not intended for anything heaver than a shirt pocket type digital camera but it works great for those. I have a GoPro Hero 2 and needed a way to video myself. With the GoPro field of view, my arm is not quite long enough to get a good shot. This extension is perfect! Just hold it out and point the camera back at yourself and voila - works like a champ! Also does a good job with my Canon M85 when you need to shoot above the heads of a crowd. Just set the camera on self timer and raise it up to get the shot. I love this thing!

Reviews.Author: Peter K. Chow
Reviews.Content: Great product! Very well made. Seems like it will be very sturdy and durable for many years to come. I got compliments on how cool it is everywhere I went!

Reviews.Title: A must have!
Reviews.Author: dez524
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my GoPro HD camera. Absolute must have for action sports, cool angle shots, and self pics. Durable, hand grip is great material, doesn't feel cheap looking at all. If buying for GoPro, make sure you buy the Tripod adapter mount also. Absolute must have!

Reviews.Title: Awesome little multi-purpose gadget
Reviews.Author: Tana Lambert
Reviews.Content: I have owned one of these for a couple years and have enjoyed using it.  It was advertised to be used as a tool to take pictures or videos of yourself but I use it mostly for video taping my children's sporting and school activities.  I put my video camera on it and extend the monopod so I can rest the bottom of it on my leg or a bleacher.  I place the camera at my eye level and then I hold onto the monopod instead of the camera.  This way it is more stable and less jerky and bumpy while filming.  Plus it gives me the ability to film above people's heads that are in front of me.  I just raise it above the obstruction and tilt the viewfinder where I can see what is being filmed.  Works awesome!  I bought this monopod for my friend for her birthday because she films a lot of the same things as I do and she can see how much easier it is with the monopod.

Reviews.Title: I like it for a different use, great for iPhone tripod connection
Reviews.Author: peggyduncan
Reviews.Content: I tried using the XShot for what it was built for, but when I attached my iPhone, everything ended up being too heavy for me to extend and take a photo. And I didn't like the way I looked (in the photo) struggling trying to hold the camera steady enough to take a good shot.But...I love the hard iPhone case that comes with this unit. And the attachment that holds the XShot is perfect for attaching my iPhone 4 to a tripod.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Corey
Reviews.Content: Product is very nice, I don't think the feel or quality was bad for the $20.00 price tag. I like it does reach reasonably far for what I need, however the last section I fold because a heavier camera will end up making it fall down anyhow. I like the adjustable and swivel head is also nice & if not using the full arm, its even very nice to just use it as a handle for taking shots. Very nice, worth the money, don't use it all the time but nice if needed! Use on Sony  cyber-shot models & there handycam!

Reviews.Title: Awesome device!
Reviews.Author: Steven S. Hoffman "Colonel Mustard"
Reviews.Content: I love this Xshot.  Brilliant idea!  Very useful.  Sometimes I forget to bring it along, and I kick myself.Hoff

Reviews.Title: Fantastic when traveling!
Reviews.Author: Amanda Eubanks
Reviews.Content: Took this on a 6 week backpacking trip through Europe and it was fantastic for taking pictures of my husband and myself. We got a lot of shots that we wouldn't have been able to get otherwise and we didn't have to risk handing our camera to people we didn't know. We have a little Canon point and shoot digital camera and it screwed on well, was sturdy, had no problems with the angle rotation. The extender folds up to about 6 inches. I only wish it was a little longer.

Reviews.Title: Great Travel Item
Reviews.Author: ahillen2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took this on our honeymoon and we got some great pictures using it. You feel a bit silly using it sometimes but it works well. My camera was secure on it and it wasn't a bother to carry it around.

Reviews.Title: Great folding monopod.
Reviews.Author: O. Sternberg
Reviews.Content: Rugged. Well made. Good price. Purchased this and a cell phone 'grip' for my Samsung Galaxy S phone so I could extend my phone out about 4 feet from my body, aim the cell phone camera at my face, and make video commentaries. This is the perfect monopod for doing this. Folds up to a very small carry size. Purchased based on others' reviews. Was very satisfied with this purchase. Shipped quicker than promised.

Reviews.Title: not bad
Reviews.Author: scubavos
Reviews.Content: i bought this for my GoPro...worked great, but not as durable as I would have hoped.  After a full days use, I noticed the camera did not remain securely tightened.

Reviews.Title: Loved it
Reviews.Author: RaR
Reviews.Content: This is a revolution! i bought both sizes to be honest but didnt see too much of a difference picture wise, almost everyone who sees it asks where i got it from. it takes pictures perfectly. it takes a while to get used to the angle to which you hold the extender but i have the samsumg camera with the front screen so its perfect for me. I cant wait to use it in my honeymoon!!!

Reviews.Title: Simple Concept Great Results
Reviews.Author: Amy Ann "ak88"
Reviews.Content: I bought this product to take on a trip to Hawaii for me and my boyfriend. This thing is small enough to fit in my purse which is great and it is really light weight so we will be able to take it with us when we hike. The construction feel really sturdy, and even with my camera on it (Cannon powershot SD750 elph) the screw holds that suck right in place, no wobble or anything. And if you can take the "myspace" picture with you arm out, this thing is a piece of cake. Definitely recommendThe only problem I can possibly see with this is that we might look a little weird with this device, but if it captures great pictures then I am ok with it!

Reviews.Title: awesome photography tool for the price
Reviews.Author: Timothy Donaldson
Reviews.Content: I have a small waterproof, shockproof point and shoot that I use to complement my DSLR.  This small and inexpensive tool can produce amazing shots when you're by yourself.  [...]As you can see the xshot enables you to not only take more natural looking self portraits but also get your camera into some unusual places.  I have also used it as a makeshift tripod while fishing...long story short the xshot is WELL worth the price.  I saw a comment about the handle slipping off...mine did as well but it didn't affect the performance and I simply duct taped it back on.

Reviews.Title: does the job
Reviews.Author: Ross N
Reviews.Content: i'm no filmographer, but this has been really handy for filming rock climbing, where it's nice to get that extra distance when the climber is higher up on the problem. it's also nice for getting a closer view without being in the way of swinging feet, etc.

Reviews.Title: Works awesome
Reviews.Author: J. D. Cayer
Reviews.Content: This gets great shots on the go, great quality part, a must have part of my camera bag now!Be prepared to explain what you are doing everywhere you use it, it will get you weird looks, but the pictures come out great if you are out and about and don't want to give strangers your camera!

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera accessory
Reviews.Author: Knife G "Knife G"
Reviews.Content: I chose this over the Quickpod due to comments related to the camera rolling over with the Quickpod extender.The packaging is a little cheap.  Takes a bit of an effort to extend which is ok.  I just hope it doesn't loosen over time to where it starts to slide shut.  The telescopic shaft is notched to avoid the camera from rolling over on it side which I thought was a nice touch.  It is sturdy when held in the hand.  The plastic parts on the extender looked a little cheap and the finishing on them wasn't that great.  But they do the job.  It is light and very compact when closed.  It also has a lanyard.Taking pictures is much better than the good old extending the arm method.  But you do have to get the tilt right otherwise you'll be taking shots a little high or low.  But with practice I am sure the shots will improve.Overall, a very decent product that will put itself to good use.

Reviews.Title: NO Fit
Reviews.Author: SHirley Bucci
Reviews.Content: TPocket Xshot XSP1 extendable hand held extender DOES NOT fit the GoPro camera.  It was suggested along with other accessories to be purchased with the camera.  I bought it and it does not fit he Go Pro.  WHY do you advertise this piece of equipment for sale with the camera when it does not fit it?  Now I have to go out and look for the extender that will fit into the camera to use.  This was a very deceitful marketing.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't get it to work with GoPro
Reviews.Author: macie morris
Reviews.Content: We ordered this for my son as a birthday gift and could not get it to work with his GoPro camera.

Reviews.Title: The Xshot XSP1 Pocket Extender broke on first use !  Weak plastic at the neck between metal tubes and camera mount.
Reviews.Author: T
Reviews.Content: Look for different  "Selphie" extendable arm and save your camera!  I thought MONOPOD meant single pole NOT single use!!!!I mounted my GoPro Hero 3 to the 1/4" thread and after minutes of using this to record my two dogs as they walked around the yard (at their eye level) the end with the camera attached dropped off of the pole.  I had a safety string that caught that stopped it from hitting the walkway, but come on !!!  The end that holds the camera is all plastic and the metal pole is crimped onto a small plastic neck ( about 1/2 the diameter of my pinkie finger).  The broken plastic end was shiny and  brittle, likely  due to poor molding processes and then they crimped a metal tube around it, smashing a brittle piece of plastic in the manufacturing process is not a good idea!.  If any of these things work for more than 5 minutes after unpackaging, it will be a miracle.  Needs to be redesigned ! Do not risk placing a camera on this single use toy.......

Reviews.Title: Cheap Plastic
Reviews.Author: Frederick J. Martino
Reviews.Content: I went cliff jumping with my go pro attached to the end of this and the plastic that connects the monopod to the mount snapped. Now my go pro is 150 at the bottom of Raystown Lake. The cliff was only 35 feet high so the impact should not have been that bad to snap it. POS

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work well
Reviews.Author: Lindsay
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a trip to Europe. It is clumsy to use and hard to hold the camera/pole in the right position to actually take a good picture. Someone saw me fumbling around with it and offered to take my picture instead. For the rest of the trip, I just asked others to take my picture and ended up returning this. Plus, you look really stupid trying to use it! Not worth it.

Reviews.Title: More Useful than you imagine
Reviews.Author: Imorante
Reviews.Content: Maybe when you see this product you'll think this is just another useless gadget, but it isn't! This product allow you to take pictures in that times you couldn't before. Great purchase

Reviews.Title: Back In The Picture... ;-)
Reviews.Author: S. M. Roque
Reviews.Content: As the family photographer for years, I can count on one hand the number of photos featuring me.;-)We own a heavy duty, telescopic tripod which folds down to 9.5", capable of holding a big, heavy camcorder steady, which we take to family functions and vacations, but at 1 lb 5.4 oz or 606g, it is not convenient to carry all the time.The XShot Pocket Telescopic Camera Extender folds down to less than 7.5" and it weighs in at 4.5 oz or 127g.Because it is small and lightweight, I have been carrying it in my purse, with my point and shoot Canon PowerShot A410 (weight: 7.0 oz or 199g), at all times since I received it.  It also is capable of supporting my Olympus Stylus Epic Zoom 80 35mm film point and shoot camera (weight with roll of 24 exposure film: 7.8 oz or 221g).I would probably not expect it to carry a full-sized digital camcorder or a big SLR camera, but I did not test the XShot's camera weight limit.I have also used the XShot as a monopod, to help me steady low-light shots.  It's not going to replace a heavy duty monopod that doubles as, say, a hiking staff, but in a pinch in has helped me take less-shaky, slow aperture shots.Of course, the best thing about carrying this XShot is that I don't have to wait for someone to take a photo with me in it.The photos do tend to be more "extreme close-up" than those taken from four feet away by another person, but they are much better than the "super-extreme close-up" photos taken with only one's arm extended.  Those in the photos also appear more relaxed than what is possible when one is extending one's arm out as far as possible.:-)On the downside, I have only been able to fit about 3 faces at a time in a shot while using the XShot with my PowerShot 410.

Reviews.Title: very solid
Reviews.Author: jerry k.
Reviews.Content: It's very sturdy- will even hold an SLR if not extended all the way. The end cap needs work though. I wouldn't trust it on a tripod.

Reviews.Title: Great camera tool
Reviews.Author: Marjorie Phillips "Marj"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my husband for Christmas.  Although we haven't attempted to take it out to use yet I know we will soon.  We tried it out but still need to practice with the settings.  This will definitely come in handy our out sightseeing around DC and the many adventures we take when it's only the two of us.  I like that it's small and will fit in my purse since we tend to travel light.

Reviews.Title: Why not ?
Reviews.Author: A. NOGUEIRA
Reviews.Content: When I bought my GoPro Hero2 camera, Amazon showed me this pocket Xshot accessory. Now I ask : Why does NOBODY said I would need to buy a tripod mount to they work together ???? Unbelievable !!!
